question: 一月
sourceAnswer:
<read>いちがつ</read>:<tag><ja>１月</ja></tag>:: January | first-month-of-the-lunar-calendar
<read>ひとつき</read>|<read>いちげつ</read>:: one-month
userAnswer:
<tag><read>いちがつ</read>:</tag> January
<tag><read>ひとつき</read>:</tag> one-month
activeAnswer:
<tag><read>いちがつ</read>:</tag> January
<tag><read>ひとつき</read>:</tag> one-month
sourceMnemonic: Since the kanji <ja>月</ja> mean both moon and month (because a moon cycle is about a month, presumably), what is the number one month? In English we have an actual name for it, and that name is <vocabulary>January</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. <ja>月</ja> has two on'yomi readings, but it always uses the <ja>がつ</ja> reading in the names of the months, so here's a mnemonic to help you remember that:

<vocabulary>January</vocabulary> always gives you <reading>itchy</reading> <reading>guts</reading> (<ja>いちがつ</ja>). It's a weird affliction that comes around every January and makes your guts incredibly itchy. Probably due to all that overindulgence over the new year.
